title: Letter Writing: Is it okay to put page numbers in a formal letter? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is required for all formal and business letters. This is something taught in all secretarial courses. Page numbering is optional when it’s a single sheet. If you’re trained in the Pitman’s Institute way, the most usual style is at the top of every sheet:— [recipient’s surname or subject title] / [date] / [page number] Smith / 22 June 2016 / 2 Bigga Biscuits / 22 June 2016 / 28

As the other answer stated, if you have more than one page, especially more than 2 pages, it would be a very good idea. Also, double check your contact details, make sure your date is correct, and don't forget to include a proper salutation.
